intro: Dehaasia cuneata, commonly known as the narrowleaf dehaasia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
